--- John Arrowwood <jarrowwx@...> wrote:
> The bigger problem for the moment is extracting the
> training data within 
> this lifetime. :)  

What is your source for a training set?

> I was thinking that I would start out with only
> connections between the one 
> pixel that represents the average of the output
> pixels in the same area.  
> That would be one connection per output node for a
> total of 64 connections 
> only involving 4 inputs.  The rest of the inputs
> would be initially ignored.

Just to try to clarify...your network topology is a
4x16 fully-connected feedforward network?  Is that
right?  The four pixels of the small image are input
into the four input nodes, and the 16 output nodes
output pixel values for the enlarged image?

> Hmm...  What does that mean, exactly?

See the thread starting here:

http://groups.yahoo.com/group/neat/message/8

But it sounds like your already using this approach
(unless I'm misunderstanding what you're doing).  

What are the dimensions of the images you are
enlarging?  I'm getting the impression that you're
starting with something like a 100x100 pixel image and
enlarging it to 200x200, in 2x2 chunks at a time.  Is
that right?

Derek
